abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Third Secondary
            Education Project for Buenos Aires was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was Likely, the institutional development
            impact was substantial, and the Bank and borrower
            performance were both satisfactory. The lessons learned
            indicate that despite three changes of provincial Governors
            and Ministers of Education, the provincial political and
            educational authorities of the Province of Buenos Aires
            provided consistent support throughout the entire project
            cycle leading to a successful implementation of the
            education reform in the province. The implementation of the
            education reform in Argentina was gradual and progressive.
            The efficient project management and implementation capacity
            of the Project Implementation Unit was a key factor in
            achieving project targets. The project's design and
            implementation strategy included clear targeting criteria to
            focus project activities in those high-risk students and
            schools to improve the equity of the secondary education
            system. Strategies and interventions were based on a solid
            school-based diagnosis made by the same school stakeholders.
            Social participation, mainly through the school's
            cooperative association was key for the successful provision
            of learning supplies, and completion of the entire
            construction and rehabilitation component. Tracer studies
            are recommended instruments to assess the impact of the
            formal technical-professional education system on the formal
            and non-formal labor markets with respect to the
            employability and working performance of their graduates.
